arm_group.arm_group_label: patients who underwent surgery for congenital heart disease
arm_group.description: patients who underwent surgery for congenital heart disease between 2011 and 2013 in Samsung Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock:
High tidal volume during mechanical ventilation has been reported to increase mortality in
      patients with acute lung injury or acute respiratory distress syndrome. High tidal volume
      was also reported to be associated with increased mortality in adult patients without acute
      lung injury or acute respiratory distress syndrome. However, the influence of high tidal
      volume on clinical outcome in pediatric patients who underwent surgery for congenital heart
      disease has not been evaluated yet. The investigators attempted to evaluate the effect of
      tidal volume on clinical outcome in both cyanotic and non-cyanotic congenital heart disease.

clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Tidal Volume During Mechanical Ventilation on Postoperative Clinical Outcome in Pediatric Patients Undergoing Congenital Heart Surgery
clinical_study.condition: Patients Who Underwent Surgery for Congenital Heart Disease

detailed_description.textblock:
High tidal volume during mechanical ventilation has been reported to increase mortality in
      patients with acute lung injury or acute respiratory distress syndrome. High tidal volume
      was also reported to be associated with increased mortality in adult patients without acute
      lung injury or acute respiratory distress syndrome. However, the influence of high tidal
      volume on clinical outcome in pediatric patients who underwent surgery for congenital heart
      disease has not been evaluated yet. The investigators attempted to evaluate the effect of
      tidal volume on clinical outcome in both cyanotic and non-cyanotic congenital heart disease.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  pediatric patients who underwent surgery for congenital heart disease with
             cardiopulmonary bypass between 2011 and 2013 in Samsung Medical Center

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  patients who lack data regarding mortality, creatinine, estimated glomerular
             filtration rate, or urine output.

study_pop.textblock:
pediatric patients who underwent surgery for congenital heart disease with cardiopulmonary
        bypass

intervention.arm_group_label: patients who underwent surgery for congenital heart disease

clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Tidal Volume During Mechanical Ventilation on Postoperative Clinical Outcome in Pediatric Patients Undergoing Congenital Heart Surgery

primary_outcome.description: Patient Mortality at six month after surgery

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: In-hospital, one-month and one-year mortality after surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: in-hospital, one-month, and one-year after surgery

secondary_outcome.description: acute kidney injury as defined by RIFLE criteria (for Risk, Injury, Failure, Loss, End-stage kidney disease)
secondary_outcome.measure: acute kidney injury as defined by RIFLE criteria (for Risk, Injury, Failure, Loss, End-stage kidney disease)

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
